moves.1. e3: Hi guys, again, this is a game in progress. I put this up because this indeed is interesting game, or I am pretty sure it will develop into one.
moves.4. Bxe5 Ne4 5. Bb5+: I checked him with my bishop to develop a piece and to prepare for castling.
moves.6... c6: Attack on my bishop, and moblized his queen.
moves.8... f6: I guess... attack on my other bishop.
moves.11. e4: I was keen on breaking center control.
moves.11... Qe8: Glenda moves to a somewhat better positioning.
moves.12. exd5 cxd5: Creates a gap in his left side and also locks in his knight.
moves.13... Kf7: King moves, notice that it frees the movement of the knight.
moves.16. Nb5: Aiming for the d6 square, which would win me a queen. If the bishop wasn't there.
moves.16... a6: Trying to capture my knight and destroy my plan.
moves.17... Nxb4: It didn't work out so well.
moves.18... Qc8: Glenda moves to support the bishop.
moves.20... Nxc2: I am surprised that he just didn't take the bishop.
moves.21. Rac1: Gives me an extra turns for better positions.
moves.23. Qh5+: I am really glad that I came up with this move. Notice that only f8 would save him from future checks and even then, I can take d5 and eventually push my rook up to attack his queen.
moves.23... g6: This probably was the best he could think of.
moves.24. Qxd5+: This way, I am now able to save my bishop.He can uncheck it by moving the knight, but I wouldn't bet on it.
moves.25. Rxc5: Another attack, now we are even in numbers and actually, I am in a better position.
moves.25... Qf5: A, what a foolish mistake! Now, I have many options. I can move my bishop to c4, take the knight, ect...
moves.26. Qd6+: But I decided to do this. Now,  King is forced to move. No other piece is avaible. And I get a queen for a price of a rook.
moves.27. Bc4+: I decided to give him a second chance of life, because I believe this was just a stupid mistake and things could be a lot better for him. Notice that if I checked with my rook instead of my bishop, I was guaranteed a checkmate. Not really a good second chance, though.
moves.27... Ne6: Wow.... Okay, maybe he isn't so bright after all.
moves.28... Ke8: king to g8 would have been better, but it is checkmate either way.
moves.29. Qe7#: ... Thanks for.... getting into this to the finish, and let's find out how the others turn out.
